file_content.text: You should head out. I don't think there's anything more you can do here.
Well--if it isn't my favorite Jedi. You look like you just walked out of a sandstorm.
Well--if it isn't my favorite soldier. You look like a mess--must've been some fight.
Well--if it isn't my best freelancer. I don't know what your secret is, but I doubt I can afford it.
Was there a base? Did you see the device?
Kamus was worried that if you failed, it'd mean the end of the world.
Well, I--you saw Czerka's records!
Yeah, and I've been worried, too. So catch your breath, then let's hear it.
That device... it had an ancient creature trapped inside. It had gone insane--I had to kill it.
There was an alien.
You're kidding! I had no idea... but if it's settled, that's good enough for me.
The upper levels were deserted. I found the device down below, but it was broken, useless.
The place was empty.
After all that? Huh. Still, we deserve a little luck.
Leksende ambushed me--but I stopped him and the device.
I ran into Czerka.
Wish I could say I'm surprised--thanks for handling them.
Let's say the problem's been solved, and leave it at that.
You don't need details.
Huh. I'll let my superiors handle the debriefing, then.
So this is over? We're sure?
You'll still need to testify, Kamus. The investigation of Czerka won't end here.
Get me to Coruscant, away from the Sand People and Czerka cyborg assassins--I'll testify all you want.
You should know, scanners picked up a Czerka ship leaving orbit. Those goons packed up and left, but they'll be trouble, someday.
I'm sure the SIS can deal with a few corporate thugs.
You'll manage.
I just hope I get to tangle with Leksende again.
Are you holding me responsible for that?
Should I feel guilty?
Not unless there's something you're not telling me.
Not my issue.
Never said otherwise. The Republic's had issues with Czerka for decades.
You should know, scanners picked up a Czerka ship fleeing the system. They're running scared, now.
Without Leksende, they've lost their claws.
They won't be a problem.
Too bad we couldn't bring down the entire company.
A pity Czerka still exists.
We stopped the device from hurting anyone. That's enough of a win.
If they cause any more problems, they're dead men.
They should be terrified.
Anyway, I promised you payment. Don't ever say the SIS isn't grateful.
Now take care of yourself. And try not to get pulled back into these corporate schemes--Kamus can tell you, they never really end.
Soon as you download the code fragments, the base is all yours. Watch out in there.
Yeah. Turns out Czerka didn't come to Tatooine to build or test the device.
They found it here, underground. An artifact powerful enough to wipe out a planet just buried in the desert.
Disaster struck, and they left it behind.
Until things went wrong.
That's what I'm thinking.
No corporation should control something that powerful.
Czerka can't have it.
If Czerka found the device on Tatooine, who created it?
But where did it come from?
How does a weapon like that get manufactured and left behind?
But where did it come from?
I don't know. The files don't say--we only know a few facts for certain.
Czerka probably wanted to mass-produce the things.
And to make a profit.
Now there's a horrifying thought.
They shouldn't have left it behind. They're not getting it back.
Finders, keepers.
I agree completely.
Czerka discovered the device. They analyzed it. Then something happened that made them abandon it....
Kamus? Has the computer cross-referenced the scans with Grommik's schematics?
Um. Yes. It looks like the main entrance is a few kilometers away. What about the door codes?
There's a bunch of relay towers around the base. They'll have a mess of data, the codes along with old communications.
Downloading everything from the relay towers will allow you to get into that base and destroy the device. It can't fall into the wrong hands.
We don't even know what the device does.
I wish we knew more, first.
Czerka saw it as a doomsday weapon. That's enough.
On my way.
So, how many medals would you say I'll get?
The Republic better be happy.
I'll have to check protocol on that one.
Save the inspirational speech for someone else.
I don't need a pep talk.
I'm no good at that sort of thing anyway.
Be careful in the base--in case they left traps, or if Leksende finds you....
That'll do, Kamus. Time to let professionals finish the job.
Still a few minutes before those scans are processed. Huh. What about...
Hey--look who made it back!
Bad news, Fauler. That reading was a Czerka listening post.
Blast. Leksende must've set it up.
Now the cyborg freak has our data. Czerka can find their lost base as easily as we can.
Czerka abandoned that base; does it really matter if they find it now?
Why should they care?
I take it that means the readings came through?
You found something, then?
Yeah. Machines are sorting through it now. But if Leksende's on the trail....
Czerka was bound to find their own base.
Hardly a surprise.
But I don't have to be happy about it.
We assumed Czerka came to keep us out of the facility. Maybe we were mistaken. Maybe they want what they left behind.
Grommik's files. We saw some things...
All we need are those scans. Then we can find the Czerka base.
...all right. We should be able to determine a rough location of the base from these charts.
Problem is, the sands have shifted over the last few decades. We'll need some geo-readings to determine the facility's exact coordinates.
What does taking these readings involve?
How do we do that?
We need to deal with Czerka.
Let's take out Leksende, first.
I agree, but Czerka's out of our reach. Our goal should be to rediscover their base before they do.
Call me when you're ready to go inside.
Guess I'll just wait, then.
Hold on. I promise, when this is all over, the Republic will make it worth your while.
The data isn't hard to get, in theory. I can give you a field scanner that'll dip into the sand, put us on track.
But... a lot of this territory is unexplored. Locals talk about Sand People communities, krayt dragons the size of starships.
Someone has to go, and I'm best-suited for the job.
I can handle it.
Jedi have always explored places others fear.
I can handle it.
There's nothing out there a well-aimed blaster can't take down.
I can handle it.
Can't argue with that.
Hey, if Czerka could make it out there, why not me?
It can't be that dangerous.
Czerka probably had an army of employees and droids--but fair enough.
That bad, huh?
It's almost like you don't want me to risk my life.
You trying to scare me off?
If you take readings in a couple of places, I can figure out the base location.
Meet me back here when you're done. Take it slow and be careful.
Try to appreciate the scenery, Kamus. Most people never get to visit a place like this.
This is a horrible place. No wonder Czerka built their base in the Dune Sea--no one would ever want to look for it here.
He'll adjust. How was your visit to old man Grommik?
Aside from Leksende burying us alive, it went alright.
Just a few problems.
Too much to hope we'd seen the last of him. Mind if I see what you got for your troubles?
Take a look at what I found.
Productive.
Grommik's senile--talked a lot of garbage.
Barely worthwhile.
Looks like you got something out of him, anyway. Mind if we take a look?
These are official Czerka records from Secret Weapons Division 7.
Schematics, survey maps--looks like Grommik came through for us. Don't go anywhere--I think we're going to need you.
See if you can get information on the facility from Grommik while we set up the forward outpost.
Check in with me at the desert outpost. I'll have more information by then.
Look, Kamus and I could use some time to review this data, but I still need you. If you're heading into the desert, give me a call.
You expect to find something out there?
What's in the desert?
I have suspicions. Hoping these files will confirm them.
I started this mission. I intend to finish it.
I'm in until the end.
I'll keep working for you--but I don't like where this is going.
Don't make me regret this.
Frankly? Neither do I.
You can reach me from a secure line at one of the militia bases. We'll talk soon.
I'll feel a lot better when we change bases, Fauler. I don't like this.
You say that now, but just wait until you see the real desert.
Hey, look who's back! And alive! You able to find anything?
I found your data--along with Gamorreans and a Czerka strike team.
Trouble.
Blast. Guess they must be one step ahead of us.
Got the data.
Credits first.
Really...? Fine, here's some credits. Now let's see what you've got.
Ah, Master Fauler? It looks like there's a call coming in...
Why, hello everyone! Master Fauler! Master Orden!
And my good friends from the Gamorrean hideout--especially nice to see you again. You're doing well, I hope?
And my little visitor from the Gamorrean hideout--especially nice to see you again. You're doing well, I hope?
This man led the Czerka team I encountered.
Fauler, I know this guy.
Not a friendly face, then.
You again?
You tried to kill me back there. Glad to see I'll have my chance at you.
I'm going to destroy you.
Granted, our friendship has been a rocky one. Let's work on that.
Since I didn't get the chance before, I thought I'd formally introduce myself. I am Gayem Leksende, here on behalf of Czerka Corporation.
I know that name...
I understand that the Republic is disputing Czerka's property rights. I've come to Tatooine to retrieve our belongings--including Kamus Orden.
You're after more than an accountant.
Just Kamus? Really?
Perhaps--but one has to start somewhere.
Kamus is a person--he's not Czerka property.
Don't threaten him.
No, no, Jedi. I have his employment records right here. He's very much our property.
Why don't we discuss this? Come meet us.
Let's talk.
Mm. I'm going to say "no," Jedi, although I do like your style.
That man is under military protection.
Kamus isn't going anywhere.
You corporate types think you own everything.
Kamus is a "belonging"?
Because we do.
Go ahead, take the accountant. I'm not attached.
Fine with me.
This person doesn't speak for the Republic, Leksende. We're not letting Kamus go.
I'm so very sorry to hear that.
Czerka will take any actions necessary to protect its interests. And I assure you, our representatives in the Senate can excuse any "incidents."
Leksende--they say he's the son of an executive. He's supposed to run the company's special enforcement branch.
Rich boy who took up wetworks as a hobby. Up to his neck in cybernetics.
Good news is, Czerka wouldn't have sent him if we were on the wrong track. He wants to keep us from the old facility.
Those Gamorreans can be crafty. Stay sharp out there.
What are you doing?
Fauler, here. The data's coming in. Looks like this'll give us what we need, but--huh.
I'm getting an energy signature not too far from you--some sort of installation, cloaked from long-range sensors.
If you would, head on over and see if there's anything there. Could just be a glitch in the scanners, but I doubt it.
All right. Could just be a glitch in the scanners... still, I don't like this.
Send me the coordinates and I'll take a look.
Worth investigating.
I don't suppose it could be the Czerka base?
Any idea what it is?
I don't think so. That base is old and deep underground--this looks like something new.
For all we know, it's some local's spice lab.
Maybe it's nothing.
Not with this sort of tech.
On my way.
Acknowledged. Fauler out.
Don't be so pessimistic.
I didn't get this far in life by being overconfident.
Save your opinion for someone who cares.
I don't need your analysis.
Next time, I will.
Come on back to camp when you're done. Fauler out.
